title: I'm winning bot lane, until their mid Zoe got 2 redemptions in a row.
body: I guess my laning phase is dependent on enemy mid laner's RNG now? And that is fair?

replies.body:
I don't know why Zoe can even pluck random actives/summoners off minions at ALL. I mean, isn't she supposed to be some kind of spell thief? She should only be able to pick up actives/summoners of people who USED them. 

I usually don't have an issue with Zoe in lane, but I had an incident where two days ago, she randomly got ignite and immediately used it on me. Then she used a protobelt, into an immediate GLP. And not 30 seconds later, I got redemptioned in lane. Like COME ON. This doesn't feel like a trickster using my own abilities against me. It feels like I'm playing against a hacker who can just spam random abilities at their leisure.

Actually I just remembered she had that Cyberpop Zoe skin...hm...

Every time CertainlyT makes a new champion, they are hacking like a motherfuxker. When Yasuo first come out every mage must be like "WTF that windwall blocked my 1k burst combo he's hacking!". Same for Kalista, how could Rito's champ design team not realize able to infinitely kite is cancerous for melee champions? Dude can't make something without having everyone be like "why is this a thing?".

Maybe because all of his champions he creates is utterly broken with overloaded kits that makes League a joke in terms of balance? It's ilke Riot actually believes that if all champs are broken and OP then its a balanced game.
Because they only look at what's fun to play rather than also looking at what's fun to play against. Fun to play champions mean people want to play them more = more players playing = more $$$

This is why I don't really like the whole "this champion's so cool because they get to break the rules" spiel. For sure, it's always good to question the rules, understand why they exist, and find exceptional cases where those rules don't apply, or at least not as much, but designs like Yasuo, Kalista, Zoe, etc. don't really do that. They break the rules, but do so in a manner that neither makes any tradeoffs nor gives their opponents any further options, and so predictably cause horrendous interaction problems with other champions. Zoe's randomness isn't there because it's under tight control so that it remains fair, or because it adds fun gameplay for everyone involved, it's there because someone just decided to ignore many years' worth of warnings against RNG-based power and plonk it in. It may make the champion more interesting in the short term, but it's tremendously detrimental to the game overall, and is likely to be yet another constant pain point in League's overall design for months, even years to come.
I mean if she couldn't get them from minions her W would be borderline useless outside of teamfights.

Outside of stealing a summoner spell, one of the most powerful and potentially game changing actives in the game, on top of being able to steal many active items, she still mostly relies on her EQQ combo. Then the QREQ combo at levels 6+. She doesn't rely at all on her W active, it's just a nice bonus she gets from time to time. A sometimes nice, game changing bonus she gets from cs'ing.

I'd disagree that all of summoner spells are that gamechanging. An extra TP can be bonkers, but Flash, Heal or Ignite aren't that different from just having a regular W ability. So I'd agree that she actually getting use of her W outside of teamfights is the way it should be.

However, I'd argue that pool of actives she can get needs to be looked at - probably some of most powerful ones being put behind a level lock. If I get lucky with two Gunblades in a row early and win over my opponent, it doesn't feel good for anyone. I won and they lost because RNGesus was on my side, plain and simple. Same the other way round; if I got two Cleanses against a, say, Zed - he won most likely because I was an ability down on him, not because he outplayed me.

You sound **_really_** salty.

And she does rely on it for defensive capabilities and other utility.  Sure she doesn't need it for damage, but the game isn't all about damage.

I actually like Zoe's design, and I don't even really care how much burst her EQQ combo does. It has counterplay, at least in lane. Maybe it needs toned down late, but in lane it feels fair. When she gets ult, you just have to stay back a bit further so she can't point blank E you. This is all well and good. Even stealing item actives and summoner spells on her W is actually fine. 

You use a flash, now she can use that against you. 
You use ignite aggressively, now she can do the same. 
Use gunblade, well now she has a gunblade. 

There's play and counterplay at work in all this. You have to think about "Should I use this now, or would Zoe make better use of it?" I like Zoe's kit for the most part.

Actives from MINIONS however is just a dice toss as to whether or not Zoe can auto win lane with high damaging actives. This is not interactive. This is just (potentially) oppressive. Sometimes it is, sometimes it isn't. It depends how many gunblades, ignites, and redemptions she gets.

I definitely dislike the RNG factor of the minion drops and agree with you there.  Still, I think she needs some way to get them or she's playing with 1 less ability.

Maybe if they made the "tier" of the items/summoner spells scale with ranks in the ability?  Like first couple ranks it's just stuff like {{item:3144}} and weakened versions of barrier, ignite, and ghost?

Or they could make the direct strength of dropped item/summoner spells scale with rank in the ability.  So at rank 1 for instance, {{item:3107}} only heals for a fifth its normal value?  This way the randomness would at least be less impactful.
You know what. I'd be okay with that change actually. She shouldn't just be able to ignore leveling her W and get almost full benefit from it.

Exactly. Spell thief theme is fine, as it is predictable, and picking Zoe can be a strategic decision, which is always welcome in League. However, RNG doesn't go well in a competitive environment and should be fixed before next season (LCS).

Umm, have you read the ability?  It most certainly has a trigger.  It's triggered on enemy summoner/item usage or minions that are tagged with a balloon.  Not only that you can clearly see the shard and it also has to be picked up before it can be used.

The only random aspect is the minion that appears on average once every other creep wave if she is in lane and has the ability leveled.  This mechanic has an extremely minimal impact on the game overall.

If you are good enough to harass/zone/counterplay when your opponent is going for CS then you can EASILY zone her from picking up a shard because she will have to move out of position 95% of the time to obtain it.
You can even deny the drop to begin with. The bubble minions only drop it if they are killed by zoe.

Except crit is a widely criticized mechanic as well, again because of its RNG, and the OP made no attempt to mention crit, let alone justify it. There is a meaningful difference, though, in that crit at least is a coinflip for more damage every couple of seconds at most, often more than once a second, whereas Zoe's RNG bonuses happen at much wider intervals and can have a much larger impact, as shown in the OP's example. Therefore, Zoe's W does tend to generate more unfair scenarios than crit, even if both instances of RNG aren't good and shouldn't be in the game.
